message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken

<<<code>>>: 
```java
String str1 = "ash\ndef";
StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(str1, "\n");
String trimmedString = st.nextToken();
```

<<<explanation>>>: The StringTokenizer class in Java is used to break a string into tokens. In this case, we are using it to break the string into tokens at the newline character ("\n"). The nextToken() method returns the next token from the string. So, in this case, it will return the part of the string before the newline character, effectively trimming the string after the newline.
